description: This is your app in English.

hero.title: Owens Bot
hero.description: A Discord bot for creating pools and rating matches.

pool.title: Pools
pool.description: Create and manage pools easily with Owens. Here are some key commands to handle your pools and events in your Discord server:

commands.createpool: ?createpool <name>: Creates a new pool for the server.
commands.match: ?match <pool> <match>: Posts a match for users to bet using emojis.
commands.result: ?result <messageID> <emoji>: Sets the winning emoji for the match.
commands.finish: ?finish <pool>: Finishes the pool, assigns points and shows the event ranking.
commands.ranking: ?ranking: Shows the global ranking for the current server.

ranking.title: Ranking
ranking.description: Keep track of the competition with Owens' ranking system. Use the !ranking command to see the global standings in your server and see who's leading the game.

rate.title: Rate
rate.description: Allow users to easily rate matches with Owens. Use the !rate command to create polls where your community can rate matches from 1 to 5 stars, and !viewrating to see average ratings and votes.

features.engagement: Engages users by allowing them to rate matches interactively
features.ratings: Shows average ratings to identify fan favorites
features.feedback: Improves event feedback and community engagement

donate.title: Donate
donate.description: Support Owens' continued development! Use the !donate command to see donation options or click the button below to contribute directly through Ko-fi.

steps.2: Select the server where you want to add it (requires Admin permissions).

steps.3: Set up the .env file with your token and options.

support.text: If you have questions, use ?help or email me at

help.title: Help Command (?help)
help.description: The ?help command displays a list of all available commands for the bot, along with brief descriptions.
help.additional_info: This command helps new users to get familiar with the bot's capabilities quickly without needing to read the full documentation.

create_pools.title: What are Pools?
create_pools.description: Pools are groups or contests where users place bets on upcoming fights or matches. Each pool acts as an independent competition with its own fights and participants.

create.title: Create a Pool:
create.description: This command initializes a new pool with the given name.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?createpool SummerBrawl2025 creates a pool named "SummerBrawl2025" where fights can be added and bets placed.

add_matches.title: Add Matches:
add_matches.description: Use this command to add fights to a specific pool.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?match SummerBrawl2025 Fight1 adds a fight named "Fight1" to the "SummerBrawl2025" pool.

place_bets.title: Place Bets:
place_bets.description: Participants place bets on individual fights within a pool by selecting their predicted winner.
place_bets.note: Bets count towards the participant's total points once results are finalized.

set_results.title: Set Results:
set_results.description: After a fight finishes, use this command to set the official result.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?result 123456789 üëç marks the fighter associated with the üëç emoji as the winner.

finish.title: Finish the Pool:
finish.description: Ends the pool, calculates points, and shows final rankings.
finish.note: Use this once all fights have results and no more bets will be accepted.

check_status.title: Check Pool Status:
check_status.description: Displays the current status of the pools.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?poolstatus shows the live status and details.

show_rankings.title: Show Rankings:
show_rankings.description: Displays the global ranking for the current season.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?ranking shows the ranking of all participants from the current season.

show_global.title: Show Global Ranking:
show_global.description: Displays the global ranking across all seasons.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?rankinglobal shows the overall leaderboard combining all seasons.

seasons.title: Seasons Management
seasons.description: Seasons group multiple pools over time, helping track rankings and winners across different competitive periods.

finish_season.title: Finish a Season:
finish_season.description: Ends the current active season, registers the winner and begins a new one automatically.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?finishseason will close the current season (e.g., global) and start a new one (e.g., global2).

view_past.title: View Past Seasons:
view_past.description: Displays a list of all past seasons and their winners.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?seasons shows a history of every recorded season and the top player of each.

global_ranking.title: Global Ranking:
global_ranking.description: Shows the total points accumulated by each user across all seasons.

example.title: Example:
example.text: ?global displays the all-time leaderboard combining all season scores.
